summary: CAR WAS NOT ABLE TO START WITH CLICKING NOISE. ALSO FUEL PUMP WAS STILL RUNNING LONG AFTER CAR WAS TURNED OFF AND EXITED. PROBLEM WAS THE TIPM. THIS IS A RECALL FOR OTHER DODGE MODELS THAT ARE 2011 YET IT IS NOT FOR MY VAN. THIS IS OVER A $1000 PROBLEM TO HAVE DEALERSHIP CHANGE THE TIPM. NOW MY AIRBAG LIGHT IS ON. I'M FINDING MASS OF PEOPLE HAD THIS PROBLEM BECAUSE OF WATER INTRUSION IN CONNECTION IN ENGINE COMPARTMENT. HOW IS THIS NOT A RECALL? THAT SHOULD BE A WATER SEALED CONNECTION TO PREVENT AIRBAG SYSTEM SHUTTING OFF. WE WERE STATIONARY, CAR RUNNING, LIGHT CAME ON.
